sources.full: Honourable Heroes; Higher CR Humanoids for Encounters

trait.name: Brave
entries: The warden has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Half-Swording
entries: The Warden is able to grapple creatures whilst holding their longsword as if they had a hand free. Additionally when they make a Grapple or a Shove they have advantage on the related Strength rolls.

trait.name: Shoulder Bash
entries: If the Warden hits a creature at least twice with a melee weapon on its turn, they can make a shove attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Second Wind
entries: The Warden can use its bonus action to regain 7 ({@dice 1d8 + 3}) hit points. They regain the use of this ability after finishing a short or long rest.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Warden makes three melee attacks. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Inspire {@recharge}
entries: All allied creatures within 15 feet of the Warden gain a bonus to their attack and damage rolls equal to the Warden's Charisma modifier until the end of the Warden's next turn.

action.name: Pugno Mortis {@recharge}
entries: The Warden can light and throw a black powder bomb at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

reaction.name: Crushing Counterstrike
entries: As a reaction to a creature attempting to make a melee attack against the Warden, the Warden may force them to make an opposed Dexterity check. If the Warden succeeds they may make a single melee attack against the creature and the triggering attack is wasted. Otherwise the creature's attack happens normally.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Warden adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Warden must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Brave Devotion
entries: The centurion has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Eagle's Fury
entries: If the Centurion moves at least 10 feet towards a creature and hits it with a melee attack it deals an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage to the creature.

trait.name: Incredibilis!
entries: Once per turn, when the Centurion hits a creature with an unarmed strike they can force them to make a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Infirmus!
entries: The Centurion deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage to a creature that is {@condition prone} or {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Lion's Bite
entries: Once per turn, the Centurion may make one of their gladius attacks with a -5 penalty to the attack roll. If the attack hits, they add +10 to the attack's damage.

trait.name: Lion's Roar
entries: If the Centurion successfully grapples a creature they can make an unarmed strike against that creature as a bonus action.

trait.name: Second Wind
entries: The Centurion can use its bonus action to regain 7 ({@dice 1d8 + 3}) hit points. They regain the use of this ability after finishing a short or long rest.

trait.name: Gladius
entries: When wielding this weapon the Centurion can make one unarmed strike as a bonus action when it takes the attack or multiattack action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Centurion makes three melee attacks with its gladius or unarmed strikes. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Gladius
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage. On a hit the target must succeed a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

reaction.name: Parry Counter
entries: The Centurion adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Centurion must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon. If the attack misses after the parry, the Centurion may make one unarmed strike against the creature that made the attack.

trait.name: Impaling Charge
entries: If the Lawbringer moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with the next melee weapon attack it makes on the same turn, the target takes the attack damage as normal and is pushed back a number of feet equal to the remainder of the Lawbringer's movement speed, the Lawbringer continuing in a straight line with the target.

trait.name: Steel Will
entries: The lawbringer has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Powerful Shove
entries: The Lawbringer may replace one of their Halberd attacks on a turn with an unarmed strike. On a hit, the creature takes 6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and must succeed a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn and pushed back 5 feet.

trait.name: Ruat Caelum
entries: Whilst wielding a halberd, other creatures provoke an opportunity attack when entering the Lawbringer's reach.

trait.name: Second Wind
entries: The Lawbringer can use its bonus action to regain 8 ({@dice 1d8 + 4}) hit points. They regain the use of this ability after finishing a short or long rest.

trait.name: Swift Justice
entries: If the Lawbringer hits a creature at least twice with a Halberd on its turn, they can make a Halberd Cue attack against that creature as a bonus action.

trait.name: The Long Arm
entries: Once per turn the Lawbringer may substitute one of their melee attacks with an attempt to flip a target over them. If the creature is Large or smaller they must succeed a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be moved to within 5ft. of the Lawbringer on the opposite side to where they were, be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn and knocked {@condition prone}. Large creatures have advantage on the saving throw; Small or smaller creatures have disadvantage on the saving throw.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Lawbringer makes three melee attacks. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Halberd
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage.

action.name: Halberd Cue
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning or piercing damage. On a hit the target must succeed a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

action.name: Igneus Imber {@recharge}
entries: The Lawbringer can light and throw black powder bombs at up to three points up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 5 feet of a chosen point must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

reaction.name: Parry Punish
entries: The Lawbringer adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Lawbringer must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon. If the attack misses after the parry, the Lawbringer may make one Halberd or Halberd Cue attack against the creature that made the attack.

trait.name: Martial Advantage
entries: Once per turn, the soldier can deal an extra 2 ({@damage 1d4}) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of the soldier that isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Broadsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Cold Blooded Killer
entries: The Peacekeeper has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Deep Gouge
entries: If the Peacekeeper successfully hits a creature with a melee attack from its arming sword it can make an attack with advantage using its dagger as a bonus action on the same turn.

trait.name: Nimble Escape
entries: The Peacekeeper can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Sidestep Strike
entries: The Peacekeeper may make a single melee attack with its arming sword as part of taking the Dodge action.

trait.name: Stealthy
entries: The Peacekeeper has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Peacekeeper makes two melee attacks with its arming sword. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Arming Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage. On a hit the creature must succeed a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw at the start of its next turn or take 10 ({@damage 4d4}) necrotic damage. The creature repeats this save each turn for 1 minute or until it succeeds. Multiple instances of this effect stack.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Deflect
entries: If a melee attack misses the Peacekeeper after they take the Dodge action on their turn, the Peacekeeper may make one dagger attack with advantage against the creature that made the attack which missed.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Peacekeeper adds 4 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the Peacekeeper must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The Conqueror has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the Conqueror hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Full Guard
entries: The Conqueror can use its action to assume a defensive stance. The Conqueror gains +3 to its AC until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The Conqueror regains 9 hit points at the start of its turn if it has less than half its maximum hit points and has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Shield Charge
entries: If the Conqueror moves at least 10 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a shield bash on the same turn, the creature must make a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Wind Up
entries: The Conqueror may use its bonus action to spin its flail, readying for a powerful attack. The next attack it makes adds +5 to the damage rolled.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Conqueror makes two melee attacks. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Flail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. On a hit, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

action.name: Pugno Mortis {@recharge}
entries: The Conqueror can light and throw a black powder bomb at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: If not in Full Guard, the Conqueror adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Conqueror must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon or a shield.

reaction.name: Uppercut
entries: When a creature misses the Conqueror with a melee attack after the Conqueror has taken the Full Guard action, the Conqueror can make a flail attack against that creature if it is in range. This ends the bonus from the Full Guard action.

trait.name: Bamboozle
entries: The Gladiator may replace one of their attacks on their turn with a feint, making a Charisma (Deception) check contested by the target creature's Wisdom (Insight). If the Gladiator is successful, they have advantage on their next attack against that creature.

trait.name: Bee's Sting
entries: The Gladiator may make a single melee attack with its trident as part of taking the Dodge action.

trait.name: Brave Devotion
entries: The Gladiator has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Cheap Shot
entries: The Gladiator's first melee attack on their turn against a {@condition incapacitated} creature automatically hits.

trait.name: Fuscina Ictus
entries: Once per turn, when the Gladiator hits a creature with a trident melee attack they can force the creature to succeed a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

trait.name: Skewer
entries: Once per turn, when the Gladiator hits a creature with a trident melee attack they can skewer their opponent. The creature takes the attack's damage as normal and is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn. The Gladiator makes no more attacks on their turn. The creature takes an additional 11 ({@damage 2d10}) piercing damage at the start of their next turn.

trait.name: Standing Ovation
entries: If the Gladiator hits a creature with all four of its attacks on a turn, it may make one additional attack against the same creature. If the additional attack hits, it is considered a critical hit.

trait.name: Sucker Punch
entries: Once per turn, the Gladiator may make an attack with their buckler instead of their trident. On a hit, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Gladiator makes four trident melee attacks. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Trident
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) damage if used with both hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Buckler
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Counter Jab
entries: The Gladiator adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Gladiator must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon. If the attack misses after the parry, the Gladiator may make one buckler attack against the creature that made the attack.

reaction.name: Skewer Deflect
entries: If a melee attack misses the Gladiator after they take the Dodge action on their turn, the Gladiator may make one trident attack with advantage against the creature that made the attack which missed.

trait.name: Brave Devotion
entries: The Black Prior has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Bulwark Stance
entries: The Black Prior can use its action to assume a defensive stance. Whilst in this stance the Black Prior's movement is halved, it gains +3 to its AC and may make one melee attack as a bonus action. Additionally the Black Prior regains 7 hit points at the start of their turn. The Black Prior can exit this stance as a bonus action on their turn; they automatically exit this stance after they take the attack action, multiattack action, use the Bulwark Counter reaction or if they are {@condition incapacitated}, {@condition stunned} or knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Harsh Requiem
entries: If the Black Prior successfully hits a creature with an attack on its turn, they gain advantage on their next attack against that creature until the end of their turn.

trait.name: Tenebris!
entries: Once per turn, the Black Prior may make an attack with their shield bash instead of their longsword. On a hit, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

trait.name: Tower Shield
entries: Whilst wielding this shield, if the Black Prior is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it can use its reaction to take no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, interposing the shield between itself and the source of the effect.
Additionally if the Black Prior moves no more than half its movement speed on its turn, it counts as being in half cover against ranged attacks whilst wielding this shield.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Black Prior makes two longsword attacks. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Umbral Shelter {@recharge 5}
entries: The Black Prior may use their action to choose any number of creatures within 30 feet. The chosen creatures gain 7 ({@dice 1d8 + 3}) temporary hit points.

reaction.name: Bulwark Counter
entries: While in Bulwark Stance, as a reaction to a creature attempting to make a melee attack against the Black Prior, the Black Prior may flip a target over them. If the creature is Large or smaller they must succeed a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be moved to within 5ft. of the Black Prior on the opposite side to where they were, be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn and knocked {@condition prone}; the Black Prior then makes one melee attack against the creature with advantage. Large creatures have advantage on the saving throw; Small or smaller creatures have disadvantage on the saving throw.

reaction.name: Crushing Counterstrike
entries: While not in Bulwark Stance, as a reaction to a creature attempting to make a melee attack against the Black Prior, the Black Prior may force them to make an opposed Dexterity check. If the Black Prior succeeds they may make a single longsword attack against the creature and the triggering attack is wasted. Otherwise the creature's attack happens normally.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: While not in Bulwark Stance, the Black Prior adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Black Prior must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Martial Advantage
entries: Once per turn, the officer can deal an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of the officer that isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Officer Tactics
entries: Allied creatures have advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature within 5 feet of the officer that is hostile to it.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Martial Advantage
entries: Once per turn, the officer can deal an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of the officer that isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Officer Tactics
entries: Allied creatures have advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature within 5 feet of the officer that is hostile to it.

action.name: Broadsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Raider's Storm
entries: Once per turn, the Raider may substitute one of their attacks for a Raider's Fury. If they do this however, they make no more attacks for that turn.

trait.name: Second Wind
entries: The Raider can use its bonus action to regain 7 ({@dice 1d8 + 3}) hit points. They regain the use of this ability after finishing a short or long rest.

trait.name: Rush
entries: The Raider can double its speed until the end of its turn. Once it uses this trait, it can't use it again until it moves 0 feet on one of its turns.

trait.name: Storming Tap
entries: Once per turn, the Raider may make an attack with their long axe's pommel instead of their long axe. On a hit, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

trait.name: Stampede Charge
entries: When the Raider successfully grapples a creature, it may carry the creature and move up to half its movement speed forward before throwing the {@condition grappled} creature 5 feet in front of where the Raider stops, ending the grapple and knocking the other creature {@condition prone}.
Additionally if the Raider moved at least 10 feet towards a creature and attempts to grapple it, the Raider has advantage on its Athletics roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Raider makes three melee attacks with its long axe. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Long Axe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Pommel
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Raider's Fury
entries: The Raider makes a long axe attack against three creatures within reach that are adjacent to each other.

action.name: Bear Trap {@recharge 5}
entries: The Raider places down a {@item hunting trap|PHB}.

action.name: Fire Flask {@recharge}
entries: The Raider throws a flask of flammable liquid at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 10 feet of the chosen point must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take 12 ({@damage 5d4}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried and lasts until the end of the Raider's next turn. A creature that enters the area during that time must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity save or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Raider adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Raider must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon or a shield.

trait.name: Rush
entries: The Warlord can double its speed until the end of its turn. Once it uses this trait, it can't use it again until it moves 0 feet on one of its turns.

trait.name: Headsplitter Leap
entries: If the Warlord moves at least 5 feet straight towards a creature and hits it with its first melee attack on a turn, it may substitute its second melee attack with an attempt to headbutt a creature.

If the creature is Large or smaller they must succeed a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn. The Warlord may then make an attack with their sword as a bonus action.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The Warlord regains 9 hit points at the start of its turn if it has less than half its maximum hit points and has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Full Guard
entries: The Warlord can use its action to assume a defensive stance. The Warlord gains +3 to its AC until the start of its next turn. Whilst in Full Guard the Warlord may make one melee attack as a bonus action

trait.name: Crashing Charge
entries: If the Warlord moves at least 10 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a shield bash on the same turn, it can force that creature to succeed a {@dc 15} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice). On a failed save the creature is pushed back as far as the Warlord continues to move, up to the Warlord's remaining movement speed.

If the creature succeeds the Strength saving throw the Warlord stops adjacent to the creature. If the creature succeeds the Dexterity saving throw the Warlord continues moving past the creature for 10 feet before stopping.

trait.name: Punch Through
entries: Whenever the Warlord has disadvantage on a melee attack roll it makes with its Ulfberht Sword, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to its Strength modifier (minimum of 0) if the attack misses but the higher of the two {@dice d20} rolls would have hit.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Warlord makes two melee attacks. They may replace one or more of these attack with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Ulfberht Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Bear Trap {@recharge 5}
entries: The Warlord places down a hunting trap.

action.name: Fire Flask {@recharge}
entries: The Warlord throws a flask of flammable liquid at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 10 feet of the chosen point must succeed on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or take 12 ({@damage 5d4}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried and lasts until the end of the Warlord's next turn. A creature that enters the area during that time must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity save or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

reaction.name: Headbutt Riposte
entries: When a creature misses the Warlord with a melee attack after the Warlord has taken the Full Guard action, the Warlord can attempt to headbutt a creature.

If the creature is Large or smaller they must succeed a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn. The Warlord may then make an attack with their sword as part of this reaction. This ends the bonus from the Full Guard action.

reaction.name: Shield Counter
entries: If not in Full Guard the Warlord adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Warlord must see the attacker and be wielding a shield. If the attack misses after the Shield Counter, the Warlord may make one melee attack with their sword against the creature that made the attack as part of this reaction.

trait.name: Rush
entries: The Berserker can double its speed until the end of its turn. Once it uses this trait, it can't use it again until it moves 0 feet on one of its turns.

trait.name: Spin Chop
entries: The Berserker may make a single melee attack with its handaxe as part of taking the Dodge action.

trait.name: Dance of the Paired Blades
entries: If the Berserker successfully hits with all of its melee attacks on a turn, it may use a bonus action to make two additional melee attacks with advantage.
If all five attacks on a turn hit, the fifth attack deals an additional 5 ({@damage 2d4}) damage.

trait.name: Head Slicer
entries: If the Berserker successfully hits with their first handaxe attack on a turn, the attack deals an additional 5 ({@damage 2d4}) damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Berserker makes three melee attacks with its handaxes. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Handaxe
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Bear Trap {@recharge 5}
entries: The Berserker places down a {@item hunting trap|PHB}.

action.name: Fire Flask {@recharge}
entries: The Berserker throws a flask of flammable liquid at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 10 feet of the chosen point must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take 12 ({@damage 5d4}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried and lasts until the end of the Berserker's next turn. A creature that enters the area during that time must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity save or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

reaction.name: Brute Force
entries: If a melee attack misses the Berserker after they take the Dodge action on their turn, the Berserker may make one unarmed strike with advantage against the creature that made the attack which missed.

reaction.name: Skilled Slash
entries: The Berserker adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Berserker must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon. If the triggering attack misses, the Berserker may make one Handaxe attack against the creature that made the attack.

trait.name: Rush
entries: The Valkyrie can double its speed until the end of its turn. Once it uses this trait, it can't use it again until it moves 0 feet on one of its turns.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The Valkyrie regains 8 hit points at the start of its turn if it has less than half its maximum hit points and has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Hunter's Strike
entries: The Valkyrie may make a single melee attack with its spear as part of taking the Dodge action.

trait.name: Spear Sweep
entries: If the Valkyrie hits with its first two melee attacks on a turn, it may substitute its third attack for a sweep with its spear against a creature within 5 feet. The creature must make a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw at disadvantage. On a failed save the creature is knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition incapacitated} until the start of its next turn.
If the creature fails the save the Valkyrie can make a spear attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Pouncing Thrust
entries: If the Valkyrie moves at least 10 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a spear attack on the same turn, the attack deals an additional 4 ({@damage 1d8}) damage.

trait.name: Boar Hunter
entries: Once per turn, the Valkyrie may increase the reach for one of its spear attacks by 5 feet.

trait.name: Full Block
entries: The Valkyrie can use its action to assume a defensive stance. The Valkyrie gains +3 to its AC until the start of its next turn or until it takes damage. However, the Valkyrie's movement speed is reduced to 0 feet and it can only take the Crushing Counterstrike and Shield Tackle reactions.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Valkyrie makes three melee attacks with its spear. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. On a hit, the creature must make a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw; on a failed save the creature is knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition incapacitated} until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Bear Trap {@recharge 5}
entries: The Valkyrie places down a {@item hunting trap|PHB}.

action.name: Fire Flask {@recharge}
entries: The Valkyrie throws a flask of flammable liquid at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 10 feet of the chosen point must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 12 ({@damage 5d4}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried and lasts until the end of the Valkyrie's next turn. A creature that enters the area during that time must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity save or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

reaction.name: Crushing Counterstrike
entries: As a reaction to a creature attempting to make a melee attack against the Valkyrie, the Valkyrie may force them to make an opposed Dexterity check.

If the Valkyrie succeeds they may make a single spear attack against the creature and the triggering attack is wasted. If the Valkyrie had taken the Full Block action on their previous turn they make a shield bash attack instead of a spear attack and the bonus from Full Block ends.
Otherwise the creature's attack happens normally.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Valkyrie adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Valkyrie must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon or a shield.

reaction.name: Shield Tackle
entries: When a creature misses the Valkyrie with a melee attack after the Valkyrie has taken the Full Block action, the Valkyrie can make a Shield Bash attack against that creature if it is in range. This ends the bonus from the Full Block action.

reaction.name: Shoulder Pin
entries: If a melee attack misses the Valkyrie after they take the Dodge action on their turn, the Valkyrie may make one spear attack with advantage against the creature that made the attack which missed. If that spear attack hits, the creature takes an additional 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage at the start of their next turn.

trait.name: Rush
entries: The Highlander can double its speed until the end of its turn. Once it uses this trait, it can't use it again until it moves 0 feet on one of its turns.

trait.name: Second Wind
entries: The Highlander can use its bonus action to regain 8 ({@dice 1d8 + 4}) hit points. They regain the use of this ability after finishing a short or long rest.

trait.name: Dunmaghlas!
entries: As a bonus action the Highlander may enter an offensive stance. It gains advantage on melee attack rolls and may not take the parry or crushing counterstrike actions.
The Highlander may end this stance as a bonus action or after any Claymore attack (no action required). The stance ends automatically if the Highlander takes damage.

trait.name: Tr na ng
entries: If the Highlander successfully hits with both Claymore attacks on a turn while not in an offensive stance, it may make an additional Claymore attack as a bonus action.

trait.name: Balor's Might
entries: Claymore attacks made while the Highlander is in an offensive stance deal an additional 5 ({@damage 2d4}) damage.

trait.name: Caber Toss
entries: If the Highlander successfully grapples a creature while in its offensive stance, it may move the {@condition grappled} creature 5 feet to either side of itself as part of the grapple, ending the {@condition grappled} condition, knocking the creature {@condition prone} and making them {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

trait.name: Formorian Kick
entries: While the Highlander is in an offensive stance it may substitute one of it's Claymore attacks for an unarmed strike. On a hit, the creature takes 6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and must succeed a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be pushed back 5 feet and {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Highlander makes two attacks with its Claymore. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Claymore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 3d4 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Bear Trap {@recharge 5}
entries: The Highlander places down a {@item hunting trap|PHB}.

action.name: Fire Flask {@recharge}
entries: The Highlander throws a flask of flammable liquid at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 10 feet of the chosen point must succeed on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or take 12 ({@damage 5d4}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried and lasts until the end of the Highlander's next turn. A creature that enters the area during that time must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity save or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

reaction.name: Crushing Counterstrike
entries: As a reaction to a creature attempting to make a melee attack against the Highlander, the Highlander may force them to make an opposed Dexterity check. If the Highlander succeeds they may make a single claymore attack against the creature and the triggering attack is wasted. Otherwise the creature's attack happens normally.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Highlander adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Highlander must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Crazed Devotion
entries: The shaman has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Rush
entries: The Shaman can double its speed until the end of its turn. Once it uses this trait, it can't use it again until it moves 0 feet on one of its turns.

trait.name: Raven's Claw
entries: If the Shaman successfully hits a creature with a melee attack from its handaxe it can make an attack with advantage using its kukri knife as a bonus action on the same turn.

On a hit the target creature must succeed a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 4d4}) necrotic damage at the start of its next turn. The creature repeats this save each turn for 1 minute or until it succeeds. Multiple instances of this effect stack.

trait.name: Second Wind
entries: The Shaman can use its bonus action to regain 7 ({@dice 1d8 + 3}) hit points. They regain the use of this ability after finishing a short or long rest.

trait.name: Wild Cat's Swiftness
entries: The Shaman may make a single melee attack with its handaxe as part of taking the Dodge action.

trait.name: Blood Trance
entries: If the Shaman hits a creature affected by its Raven's Claw trait or Raven's Beak reaction with a melee attack, the Shaman regains hit points equal to the damage dealt.

Additionally if the Shaman successfully grapples an affected creature the Shaman bites them, dealing 12 ({@damage 5d4}) necrotic damage and healing the Shaman a number of hit points equal to the damage caused.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Shaman makes two melee attacks. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Handaxe
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Kukri Knife
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bear Trap {@recharge 5}
entries: The Shaman places down a {@item hunting trap|PHB}.

action.name: Fire Flask {@recharge}
entries: The Shaman throws a flask of flammable liquid at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 10 feet of the chosen point must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 12 ({@damage 5d4}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried and lasts until the end of the Shaman's next turn. A creature that enters the area during that time must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity save or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

action.name: Nail Bomb {@recharge}
entries: The Shaman sets down a nail bomb, a small portion of black powder surrounded by many metal spikes with a pressure plate on top. A creature that steps on the plate and any others in a 5 foot radius must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 4d4}) piercing damage.
Creatures that fail the Dexterity save take an additional 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage at the start of their next turn. On a successful save the damage is halved.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Shaman adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Shaman must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

reaction.name: Raven's Beak
entries: If a melee attack misses the Shaman after they take the Dodge action on their turn, the Shaman may make one Kukri Knife attack with advantage against the creature that made the attack which missed. On a hit the target creature must succeed a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw at the start of its next turn or take 10 ({@damage 4d4}) necrotic damage. The creature repeats this save each turn for 1 minute or until it succeeds. Multiple instances of this effect stack.

trait.name: Punch Through
entries: Whenever the Jormungandr has disadvantage on a melee attack roll it makes with its Warhammer, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to its Strength modifier (minimum of 0) if the attack misses but the higher of the two {@dice d20} rolls would have hit.

trait.name: Jotunn Gift
entries: If the Jormungandr successfully grapples a creature, the Jormungandr has advantage on their next melee attack roll against the {@condition grappled} creature so long as the creature remains {@condition grappled}.
On a hit the creature is pushed back 5 feet, ending the grapple, and the Jormungandr gains hit points equal to the damage dealt by the attack.

trait.name: Jotunn Farewell
entries: If the Jormungandr successfully hits a creature with a warhammer attack on its turn, they may immediately make an unarmed strike against that creature with advantage as a bonus action.
On a hit  the creature is pushed back 5 feet, and the Jormungandr gains hit points equal to the damage dealt by the attack.

trait.name: Serpent Smite
entries: If the Jormungandr moves at least 10 feet straight toward a creature and makes a melee attack against it, the Jormungandr gains advantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Hamarr Slam
entries: The Jormungandr deals an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) damage to a creature that is {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Hamarr's Favour
entries: If the Jormungandr hits a creature that is {@condition prone} with an attack from their warhammer, they gain temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Jormungandr makes two melee attacks with its warhammer. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Warhammer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. On a hit the target must succeed a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Light Hammer
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. On a hit the target must succeed a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn and knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Twilight of the Gods {@recharge}
entries: The Jormungandr smashes its hammer into the ground. Each creature within 10 feet of the Jormungandr must succeed a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage, knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

reaction.name: Jotunn Grudge
entries: The Jormungandr adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Jormungandr must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon. If the attack misses after the parry, the Jormungandr may make one unarmed strike against the creature that made the attack.
On a hit the creature is pushed back 5 feet, and the Jormungandr gains hit points equal to the damage dealt.

trait.name: Brave Devotion
entries: The Kensei has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Second Wind
entries: The Kensei can use its bonus action to regain 7 ({@dice 1d8 + 3}) hit points. They regain the use of this ability after finishing a short or long rest.

trait.name: Swift Strike
entries: The Kensei may make a single melee attack with its nodachi as part of taking the Dodge action.

trait.name: Dawn of the Steel Sun
entries: If the Kensei hits with a nodachi attack on their turn, they may make one additional attack with advantage using their nodachi as a bonus action. On a hit, it deals an extra 5 ({@damage 2d4}) damage.

trait.name: Helm Splitter
entries: Once per turn, the Kensei may make an attack with their pommel strike instead of their nodachi. On a hit, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Kensei makes two nodachi attacks. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Nodachi
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Pommel Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Inspire {@recharge}
entries: All allied creatures within 15 feet of the Kensei gain a bonus to their attack and damage rolls equal to the Kensei's Charisma modifier until the end of the Kensei's next turn.

action.name: Smoke Bomb {@recharge}
entries: The Kensei throws a smoke bomb at the floor, it emits a cloud of smoke that creates a heavily obscured area in a 10-foot radius. A moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses the smoke in 4 rounds; a strong wind (20 or more miles per hour) disperses it in 1 round.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Kensei adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Kensei must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The Shugoki regains 9 hit points at the start of its turn if it has less than half its maximum hit points and has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Punch Through
entries: Whenever the Shugoki has disadvantage on a melee attack roll it makes with its kanabo, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to its Strength modifier (minimum of 0) if the attack misses but the higher of the two {@dice d20} rolls would have hit.

trait.name: Rock Steady
entries: The Shugoki cannot be knocked {@condition prone} by non-magical means. They also have advantage on saving throws against spells or other effects that would force them to move.

trait.name: Hard to Kill
entries: If the Shugoki has less than half of its maximum hit points, it has resistance to all damage except psychic damage.

trait.name: Bonecrusher
entries: Once per turn, the Shugoki may make one of with their kanabo attacks with a -5 penalty to the attack roll. If the attack hits, they add +10 to the attack's damage.

trait.name: Headbutt
entries: If the Shugoki hits with the first kanabo attack on their turn, they may make an unarmed strike instead of their second kanabo attack. On a hit, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

trait.name: Demon's Embrace
entries: If the Shugoki successfully grapples a creature, they may use their bonus action to crush the creature in an embrace. The creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage, is knocked {@condition prone} and is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn. The Shugoki regains hit points equal to the damage dealt and ends the grapple when using this trait.

trait.name: Charge of the Oni
entries: When the Shugoki takes the Dash action they may move freely through another creatures space as long as they are Large or smaller. The creature is moved 5 feet away from the Shugoki and must succeed a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The Shugoki has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Shugoki makes two melee attacks with its kanabo. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Kanabo
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Smoke Bomb {@recharge}
entries: The Shugoki throws a smoke bomb at the floor, it emits a cloud of smoke that creates a heavily obscured area in a 10-foot radius. A moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses the smoke in 4 rounds; a strong wind (20 or more miles per hour) disperses it in 1 round.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Shugoki adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Shugoki must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Storm Rush
entries: If the Orochi moves 0 feet on its turn, it can take the ready action to perform a storm rush. This action is triggered when a hostile creature comes within 20 feet of the Orochi; the Orochi then moves up to half its movement speed towards the creature and makes a two handed Katana attack against it with advantage. On a hit, it deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage.

trait.name: Lightning Strikes Twice
entries: If the Orochi hits with a katana attack on their turn, they may make one additional attack with advantage using their katana as a bonus action. On a hit, it deals an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage.

trait.name: Zephyr Slash
entries: The Orochi may make a single melee attack with its katana as part of taking the Dodge action.

trait.name: Nimble Escape
entries: The Orochi can take the {@action Disengage} or {@action Hide} action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Orochi makes two katana attacks. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Katana
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit or {@hit 5} to hit with both hands, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Kunai
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage. The Orochi can throw up to 2 kunai as part of an attack when it takes the attack action; for each thrown above the first it adds an additional damage die.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Nail Bomb {@recharge}
entries: The Orochi sets down a nail bomb, a small portion of black powder surrounded by many metal spikes with a pressure plate on top. A creature that steps on the plate and any others in a 5 foot radius must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 4d4}) piercing damage.
Creatures that fail the Dexterity save take an additional 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage at the start of their next turn. On a successful save the damage is halved.

action.name: Smoke Bomb {@recharge}
entries: The Orochi throws a smoke bomb at the floor, it emits a cloud of smoke that creates a heavily obscured area in a 10-foot radius. A moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses the smoke in 4 rounds; a strong wind (20 or more miles per hour) disperses it in 1 round.

reaction.name: Hurricane Blast
entries: If a melee attack misses the Orochi after they take the Dodge action on their turn, the Orochi may make one katana attack with advantage against the creature that made the attack which missed. On a hit, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Orochi adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Orochi must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Second Wind
entries: The Nobushi can use its bonus action to regain 7 ({@dice 1d8 + 3}) hit points. They regain the use of this ability after finishing a short or long rest.

trait.name: Way of the Shark
entries: When the Nobushi hits with an attack using their naginata, the creature takes an additional 5 ({@damage 2d4}) slashing damage at the start of their next turn. Multiple instances of this effect stack.

trait.name: Cobra Strike
entries: The Nobushi may make a single melee attack with its naginata as part of taking the Dodge action.

trait.name: Poke the Nest
entries: If the Nobushi hits with two melee attacks on their turn, they may make one additional attack using their naginata that automatically hits as a bonus action.

trait.name: Jump Kick
entries: If the Nobushi hits with a naginata attack, they can replace the next attack they make on their turn with an unarmed strike. On a hit, the creature must succeed a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn, be pushed 5 feet back and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Viper's Retreat
entries: The Nobushi may make a single naginata attack with its naginata as part of taking the Disengage action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Nobushi makes two naginata attacks. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Naginata
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Fire Trap {@recharge}
entries: The Nobushi sets down a fire trap, a small portion of black powder surrounded by a flammable liquid with a pressure plate on top of the casing. A creature that steps on the plate and any others in a 5 foot radius must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 5d4}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried and lasts until the end of the Nobushi's next turn. A creature that enters the area during that time must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity save or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

action.name: Smoke Bomb {@recharge}
entries: The Nobushi throws a smoke bomb at the floor, it emits a cloud of smoke that creates a heavily obscured area in a 10-foot radius. A moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses the smoke in 4 rounds; a strong wind (20 or more miles per hour) disperses it in 1 round.

reaction.name: Hidden Stance
entries: As a reaction to a creature attempting to make a melee attack against the Nobushi, the Nobushi may force them to make an opposed Dexterity check. If the Nobushi succeeds they dodge back into a deceptive stance and the triggering attack is wasted; the Nobushi gains advantage on their next melee attack. Otherwise the creature's attack happens normally.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Nobushi adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Nobushi must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Yama Uba
entries: When the Shinobi hits a creature with a kusarigama attack they regain 3 ({@dice 1d6}) hit points.

trait.name: Kusarigama-Jutsu
entries: The sickle-like weapons the Shinobi uses are on chains with a weight at the end. When the Shinobi makes a ranged attack by throwing one of their kusarigama they pull the weapon back to their hand by the chain as part of the attack.

Additionally the Shinobi may attempt to grapple a Medium or smaller creature after hitting with a ranged kusarigama attack instead of dealing damage. If the grapple is successful, the Shinobi can pull the creature up to 15 feet towards them.

trait.name: Slide Tackle
entries: The Shinobi may take the Dash action as a bonus action. Additionally if they take the Dash action and move at least 10 feet towards a creature they can attempt to perform a slide tackle.

The creature must succeed a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition incapacitated} until the start of its next turn. The Shinobi moves to the opposite side of the tackled creature. On a successful save the creature is not {@condition incapacitated} or knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Sickle Rain
entries: If the Shinobi hits with two kusarigama attacks on a turn, it can use its bonus action to make three more melee attacks with its kusarigama. Each of these attacks deals an extra 5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage on a hit.

trait.name: Nimble Attacker
entries: The Shinobi can take the Disengage or Dodge action as a bonus action on each of its turns.
Additionally the Shinobi may make one kusarigama or kick attack as part of these actions.

trait.name: Flying Kick
entries: Once per turn, the Shinobi can replace a kusarigama attack with a kick attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Shinobi makes two melee or ranged attacks with their kusarigama. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Kusarigama
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 10/20 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Kick
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. On a hit the creature must succeed a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition incapacitated} until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Shuriken
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) slashing damage. The Shinobi can throw up to 3 shuriken as part of an attack when it takes the attack action; for each thrown above the first it adds an additional damage die.

action.name: Nail Bomb {@recharge}
entries: The Shinobi sets down a nail bomb, a small portion of black powder surrounded by many metal spikes with a pressure plate on top. A creature that steps on the plate and any others in a 5 foot radius must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 4d4}) piercing damage.
Creatures that fail the Dexterity save take an additional 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage at the start of their next turn. On a successful save the damage is halved.

action.name: Smoke Bomb {@recharge}
entries: The Shinobi throws a smoke bomb at the floor, it emits a cloud of smoke that creates a heavily obscured area in a 10-foot radius. A moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses the smoke in 4 rounds; a strong wind (20 or more miles per hour) disperses it in 1 round.

reaction.name: Shadow Strike
entries: The Shinobi adds 4 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Shinobi must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon. If the attack misses after the parry, the Shinobi may make one kusarigama attack against the creature that made the attack.
If the Shinobi's attack hits the creature takes an additional 5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage at the start of their next turn.

reaction.name: Teleport Deflect
entries: If a melee attack misses the Shinobi after they take the Dodge action on their turn, the Shinobi may teleport to within 5ft. of the creature on the opposite side to where they were and make one melee attack with advantage against the creature that made the attack which missed.

trait.name: Dual Wielder
entries: The Aramusha gains a +1 bonus to its AC while it wields a separate melee weapon in each hand. It can use two-weapon fighting even when the one-handed melee weapons it is wielding aren't light. It can draw or stow two one-handed weapons when it would normally be able to draw or stow only one.

trait.name: Second Wind
entries: The Aaramusha can use its bonus action to regain 7 ({@dice 1d8 + 3}) hit points. They regain the use of this ability after finishing a short or long rest.

trait.name: Rock Steady
entries: The Aramusha cannot be knocked {@condition prone} by non-magical means. They also have advantage on saving throws against spells or other effects that would force them to move.

trait.name: Rushing Wind
entries: If the Aramusha moves at least 10 feet straight toward a creature and then makes a melee attack against it on the same turn, the Aramusha gains advantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Tempest
entries: If the Aramusha hits a creature with all four of its attacks on a turn, it may make one additional attack with its dual katanas against the same creature as a bonus action. If the additional attack hits, it is considered a critical hit.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Aramusha makes four melee attacks, two with its dual katanas and two with its katana in alternating order. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Katana
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Dual Katanas
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Smoke Bomb {@recharge}
entries: The Aramusha throws a smoke bomb at the floor, it emits a cloud of smoke that creates a heavily obscured area in a 10-foot radius. A moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses the smoke in 4 rounds; a strong wind (20 or more miles per hour) disperses it in 1 round.

reaction.name: Blade Blockade
entries: As a reaction to a creature attempting to make a melee attack against the Aramusha, the Aramusha may force them to make an opposed Dexterity check. If the Aramusha succeeds they may do one of the following options against the creature and the creature's triggering attack is wasted:
- {@b {@i Ring the Bell:}} the Aramusha makes a katana attack with advantage. On a hit the target is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.
- {@b {@i Twin Vipers:}} The Aramusha makes a dual katanas attack with advantage.
- {@b {@i Push Back Kick:}} The Aramusha makes an unarmed strike. On a hit the target is pushed back 5 feet and knocked {@condition prone}.
Otherwise the creature's attack happens normally.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Aramusha adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Aramusha must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Deliverance
entries: When the Hitokiri reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the Hitokiri gains 13 ({@dice 2d12}) temporary hit points.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The Hitokiri regains 9 hit points at the start of its turn if it has less than half its maximum hit points and has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Rei Sweep
entries: Once per turn, the Hitokiri may make an unarmed strike instead an attack with their masakari axe. On a hit, the creature  must succeed a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn and is knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Mugen-ryu
entries: When the Hitokiri hits with a masakari axe attack, they can make an additional attack against the same creature as part of that attack action. The Hitokiri may make up to three additional attacks this way in one turn.
If the Hitokiri uses their Mangetsu Rift trait, Meikai trait or Senbonzakura action, they do not gain an extra attack from this trait.

trait.name: Mangetsu Rift
entries: Once per turn, the Hitokiri may make one of their masakari axe attacks with a -5 penalty to the attack roll. If the attack hits, they add +10 to the attack's damage. This cannot be used on the same attack as the Senbonzakura trait.

trait.name: Meikai
entries: When the Hitokiri hits with a masakari axe attack, they can make a masakari backswing attack as a bonus action.
If the Hitokiri uses their Senbonzakura action, they do not gain an extra attack from this trait.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Hitokiri makes two masakari axe attacks. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Masakari Axe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Masakari Backswing
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Senbonzakura {@recharge}
entries: The Hitokiri makes a masakari axe attack with disadvantage on the attack roll. If the attack hits, it is considered a critical hit and it deals an extra 22 ({@damage 3d12}) damage.
Additionally if the creature is reduced to 0 hit points, it dies.

reaction.name: Righteous Deflection
entries: The Hitokiri goes to parry and adds 4 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Hitokiri must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.
If the attack misses after the parry, they gain resistance to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage until the end of their next turn.

trait.name: Vital Leech
entries: If the Tiandi has less than half of its maximum hit points, it regains hit points equal to the damage dealt when it hits with its dao attacks.

trait.name: Indomitable
entries: When the Tiandi drops below 20 hit points they gain 18 ({@dice 4d8}) temporary hit points. If the triggering damage would reduce the Tiandi to 0 hit points, they instead remain on 1 hit point.
After this is triggered the Tiandi regains the use of this trait after they finish a short or long rest.

trait.name: Dragon Dodge
entries: The Tiandi may make a single melee attack with its dao as part of taking the Dodge action.
Additionally the Tiandi may take the Dodge action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Dragon Kick
entries: If the Tiandi successfully hits a creature with a melee attack from its dao it can make an unarmed strike with advantage as a bonus action on the same turn.
On a hit, the creature must succeed a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be pushed back 15 feet, knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition incapacitated} until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Palm Strike
entries: Once per turn, the Tiandi may make an unarmed strike instead of an attack with their dao. On a hit, the creature must succeed a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be pushed back 5 feet and {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Tiandi makes two melee attacks with its dao. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Dao
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Battlecry {@recharge}
entries: All allied creatures within 15 feet of the Tiandi gain a bonus to their attack and damage rolls equal to the Tiandi's Charisma modifier until the end of the Tiandi's next turn. All hostile creatures within 15 feet must succeed a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of the Tiandi until the end of their next turn.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Tiandi adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Tiandi must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

reaction.name: Tiger Dodge
entries: As a reaction to a creature attempting to make a melee attack against the Tiandi after they have taken the dodge action on their turn, the Tiandi may force them to make an opposed Dexterity check. If the Tiandi succeeds they may make a single dao attack against the creature and the triggering attack is wasted. Otherwise the creature's attack happens normally.

trait.name: Against All Odds
entries: If the number of hostile creatures within 15 feet of the Jiang Jun is greater than the number of allied creatures (including the Jiang Jun himself) then the Jiang Jun and all allied creatures within 15 feet gain a bonus to their melee and ranged attack's damage equal to the Jiang Jun's Charisma modifier.

trait.name: Second Wind
entries: The Jiang Jun can use its bonus action to regain 8 ({@dice 1d8 + 4}) hit points. They regain the use of this ability after finishing a short or long rest.

trait.name: Tough Discipline
entries: The Jiang Jun has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Mighty Sanction
entries: The Jiang Jun may make a single melee attack with its guandao as part of taking the Dodge action.

Additionally the Jiang Jun may instead make an unarmed strike as part of taking the Dodge action, kicking the target in the shin. On a hit, the target is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

trait.name: Twofold Slash
entries: Once per turn, when the Jiang Jun makes a melee attack they may make an additional attack with their guandao as part of the same action. On a hit, the additional attack deals an additional 5 ({@damage 1d10}) damage.

trait.name: Fatal Swirl
entries: Once per turn when the Jiang Jun takes the attack action using their guandao, they may make their attack target all creatures within reach rather than one target.

trait.name: Sifu's Poise
entries: The Jiang Jun may use his bonus action to adopt graceful stance, any creature within 20 feet of the Jiang Jun that has to make a roll to recharge one of their abilities automatically succeeds on the roll on their turn.
The Jiang Jun may end this stance as a bonus action on their turn, or it automatically ends if the Jiang Jun moves or takes damage.

action.name: Guandao
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Fire Flask {@recharge}
entries: The Jiang Jun throws a flask of flammable liquid at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 10 feet of the chosen point must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 12 ({@damage 5d4}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried and lasts until the end of the Jiang Jun's next turn. A creature that enters the area during that time must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity save or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

action.name: Inspire {@recharge}
entries: All allied creatures within 15 feet of the Jiang Jun gain a bonus to their attack and damage rolls equal to the Jiang Jun's Charisma modifier until the end of the Jiang Jun's next turn.

reaction.name: Dou Shi's Choke
entries: The Jiang Jun adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Jiang Jun must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon. If the attack misses after the parry, the Jiang Jun chokes the creature for a moment before slapping them back 5 feet, rendering the creature {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

reaction.name: Dou Shi's Swirl
entries: The Jiang Jun adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Jiang Jun must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon. If the attack misses after the parry, the Jiang Jun may make one guandao attack using his fatal swirl trait.

reaction.name: Sifu's Dodge
entries: As a reaction to a creature attempting to make a melee attack against the Jiang Jun, the Jiang Jun may force them to make an opposed Dexterity check. If the Jiang Jun succeeds they dodge back into Sifu's Poise and the triggering attack is wasted. Otherwise the creature's attack happens normally.

trait.name: Deadly Duet
entries: The Nuxia deals an extra 5 ({@damage 2d4}) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature and the Nuxia are not within 5 feet of another creature, besides themselves, that isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The Nuxia regains 8 hit points at the start of its turn if it has less than half its maximum hit points and has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Hook Trap
entries: Once per turn, the Nuxia may make one of their hooked sword attacks a trap. If the attack misses they grapple the target and may immediately make a hilt spike attack with advantage against it.
However if the trapped attack hits, it deals no damage.

trait.name: Song of the Moon
entries: If the Nuxia successfully hits with all of its melee attacks on a turn, it may use a bonus action to pull the last creature hit by its attacks 10 feet in a direction of the Nuxia's choosing.

trait.name: Crescent Step
entries: The Nuxia may make a single hilt spike attack as part of taking the Dodge action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Nuxia makes three melee attacks with its hooked swords. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Hooked Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Hilt Spike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Deadly Caltrops {@recharge}
entries: The Nuxia spreads caltrops to cover a 10-foot-square area within 30 feet of them. Any creature that enters the area must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or stop moving and take 2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage. Until the creature regains at least 1 hit point, its walking speed is reduced by 10 feet. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn't need to make the saving throw.
The Nuxia is immune to the effect of the caltrops.

action.name: Infection {@recharge}
entries: The Nuxia chooses a creature within 30 feet to make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save the creature, and any other creatures within 15 feet of them at the start of each of their turns for 1 minute, take 5 ({@damage 2d4}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Thread of Fate {@recharge}
entries: The Nuxia chooses a creature within 30 feet to make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save the creature's movement speed is halved for 1 minute.

reaction.name: Echo Strike
entries: If a melee attack misses the Nuxia after they take the Dodge action on their turn, the Nuxia may make one hilt spike attack with advantage against the creature that made the attack which missed.

reaction.name: Mirror Raid
entries: The Nuxia adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the Nuxia must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon. If the attack misses after the parry, the Nuxia may make one hilt spike attack against the creature that made the attack.

trait.name: Winner's Advantage
entries: When the Shaolin hits with a melee attack on its turn, then their next melee attack deals an additional 3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage.

trait.name: Shadowstep
entries: The Shaolin may make a single melee attack with its steel-capped staff as part of taking the Dodge action.

trait.name: Flying Monkey
entries: If the Shaolin moves at least 10 feet towards a creature and takes the multiattack action on their turn, the Shaolin may replace the first attack with their steel-capped staff with an unarmed strike. On a hit, the creature must succeed a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Qi Stance
entries: If the Shaolin makes a melee attack on their turn, they may use their bonus action to enter a Qi stance. While in this stance, the Shaolin's movement speed is reduced to 5 feet. The Shaolin may end this stance on its turn (no action required); this stance requires concentration, as if concentrating on a spell.

trait.name: Lotus Leap
entries: If the Shaolin makes a two handed attack with its steel-capped staff while in Qi Stance, the attack has advantage and deals 9 ({@damage 2d8}) additional damage on a hit.

trait.name: Sun Kick
entries: If the Shaolin is in Qi Stance, they may replace one of their steel-capped staff attacks with an unarmed strike with advantage. On a hit, the target must succeed a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the start of their next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Shaolin makes three melee attacks with its steel-capped staff. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove. They may also replace one of these attacks with Blink if they are able.

action.name: Steel-capped Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Blink {@recharge}
entries: The Shaolin teleports to an unoccupied space 5 feet behind a creature that is within 10 feet of the Shaolin and makes an unarmed strike against that creature with advantage. On a hit, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Blessed Projection {@recharge}
entries: The Shaolin chooses an allied creature within 120 feet of itself, it then teleports to an unoccupied space that is within 5 feet of the chosen ally.

reaction.name: Bounding Blossom
entries: If the Shaolin is in Qi Stance they may, as a reaction to a creature attempting to make a melee attack against them, force the creature to make an opposed Dexterity check. If the Shaolin succeeds they may make a single steel-capped staff attack against the creature and the triggering attack is wasted. Otherwise the creature's attack happens normally.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Shaolin adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the Shaolin must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

reaction.name: Shadow Deflect
